overview:
Greg Titus is a serial entrepreneur. With more than 20 years of experience in the education, finance and advertising worlds, Greg Titus founded CourseAdvisor in 2004 and co-founded Avenue100 Media Solutions in 2008.

Greg was formerly President/CEO of Acadient, a leading developer of online education services and the parent company of The Boston Institute of Finance, The Willet Institute and Boston Test Prep. Prior to founding Acadient, Greg was Senior Vice President of e-Commerce at Scudder Kemper Investments.

Greg has an extensive agency background. He helped found and served as Vice President/Director of Arnold Interactive, the interactive media division of Arnold Worldwide, and has held positions at Young & Rubicam/New York, Saatchi and Saatchi/DFS and RSC/Boston.

Mr. Titus serves as a director for several technology startups and nonprofit organizations. He is also a past member of the board of directors of the Massachusetts Innovation and Technology Exchange (www.mitx.org). He holds a bachelorâ€™s degree in marketing and art from the University of Massachusetts/Amherst and attended the McCallum Graduate School of Business at Bentley University.
